title: Crypto Price Today Live: Bitcoin falls below $22,500; Litecoin, Dogecoin tumble up to 8% - The Economic Times
content: New Delhi: The cryptocurrency markets were trading in the red on Friday, with a decline of 4% in the global crypto market cap. Bitcoin (BTC) fell 4.5% to $22,386, whereas Ethereum (ETH) was below the $1,600 level. BTC volume in the last 24 hours stood at approximately $26.01 billion, rising 12.56% in the last 24 hours."In the past 24 hours, Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other cryptocurrencies dropped in value due to the release of US manufacturing data and uncertainties concerning access to banking services for crypto companies in the US. Furthermore, the fallout of Silvergate has also played a role in the decline. Bitcoin is at its lowest point in about two weeks and is trading below $23,000 at $22,300," Edul Patel, Co-founder and CEO at Mudrex, said.Other top tokens were also trading lower on Friday. Litecoin declined by 8%. Dogecoin , Solana, Cardano, and BNB were also trading with cuts. The global cryptocurrency m-cap was trading lower around $1.03 trillion, falling 4.01% in the last 24 hours.The total volume in DeFi is currently 5.39 billion, 9.78% of the total crypto market 24-hour volume. The volume of all stablecoins is now $50.24 billion, which is 91.11% of the total crypto market 24-hour volume.The market cap of Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, was around $432.63 billion. Bitcoin’s dominance is currently 42.09%, a decrease of 0.23% over the day, according to CoinMarketCap."Big crypto-specific development to watch out for is the unfolding of events at Silvergate, as the crypto-friendly bank failed to file its annual report to the SEC, and its stock has come under heavy selling pressure. Markets are watching with bated breath to see if there's another domino left to fall post the FTX fiasco," Parth Chaturvedi, Crypto Ecosystem Lead at CoinSwitch, said.Rajagopal Menon, Vice President at WazirX, said, "Major market indicators point to a neutral sentiment. The Relative Strength Index (14) sits at 42.82, with a neutral outlook. The Stochastic %K (14, 3, 3) indicates a Neutral outlook at 24.38 and the Average Directional Index (14) at 27.69 indicates Sell.""The MACD Level (12, 26), at 159.87, indicates a Sell. The Stochastic RSI Fast (3, 3, 14, 14) is at 14.28 with a Neutral indicator, while the Williams Percent Range (14) at −89.48 also signals Neutral," Menon added.Crypto Cart: Quick Glance (Source: coinmarketcap.com , data as of 12.03 hours, IST on March 03, 2023)Bitcoin $22,386 -4.51%Ethereum $1,570 -4.57%Tether $1 -0.01%BNB $291.82 -2.46%XRP $0.3691 -2.74%Dogecoin $0.07571 -6.41%Cardano $0.337 -5.34%Polygon $1.17 -4.10%Polkadot $6.06 -5.23%Tron $0.06687 -3.81%Litecoin $89.21 -8.21%Shiba Inu $0.00001142 -4.52%Solana $21.08 -4.08%

title: Three Coins To Keep An Eye On During Crypto Spring: Cardano, Solana, and Big Eyes Coin - Atalayar EN
content:
Since its start, cryptocurrency has shown that it is more than just a craze that will eventually fade away. Digital currency is more vital than ever, thanks to the development of blockchain technology as our lives hurl recklessly into the information era. One could feel intimidated by reading through data, percentages, facts, and figures, given the wide variety of crypto coins available. In order to help you better understand your investment alternatives, today we're going to look at a few emerging stars.

Cardano (ADA): Safe, Decentralized Transactions

Based on the Ouroboros blockchain architecture, Cardano takes pleasure in providing its customers with safe, decentralized transactions. Cardano seems to be a smart option for a beginning investor, led by a group of "scientists, engineers, and thinking leaders," according to its self-described staff. With a share in the currency owned by each and every ADA bearer, the coin is rising, and for good reason. Moreover, Cardano has a strong research group that worked nonstop to pore over sociological, philosophical, financial, and game theory data in order to ensure that their coin launched in 2017 off to a strong start.

Solana (SOL): Troubling Times Melting Away

Solana, one of the big boys, is well-known (well, among crypto miners, anyway). Solana was established in late 2017 and based its uniqueness only on speed. This altcoin and its blockchain technology are based on research by its creator, Andrey Yakovenko, and revolve around the idea of forcing unfamiliar computers to communicate in accordance with a dependable clock, keeping them in time with one another. In 2018, Solana reported an incredible 500,000 transactions per second during their testing phase. This is the pinnacle of programming.

Solana now occupies a comfortable spot among the top 20 trending coins worldwide as of 2023. The world of alternative currencies is, however, a volatile one, and anything could be lurking around the corner to change the scene.

Big Eyes Coin (BIG): $30 Million And Still Going

We've previously talked about two of the biggest names in crypto, and it may all sound a little complicated and technical. Thankfully, there are coins available that are just as concerned with fun and user-friendly accessibility as they are with technology.

Big Eyes Coin is a pre-sale coin that is getting ready to take off into the cryptosphere. This adorable coin has its cat-eyes set on the top spot with 200 billion tokens and a remarkable $11.2 million in pre-launch funding. Not to mention, Big Eyes values NFT culture and recognizes its significance in the digital economy.

Big Eyes is seeking to bring a whole new generation to cryptocurrency, and it's a demographic they're cognizant of and empathic with. Big Eyes is branding itself in a warm and approachable manner with its easily recognizable mascot. In recognition of our shared obligation to safeguard the environment, Big Eyes plans to contribute 5% of its community wallet to organizations dedicated to marine conservation.

This cute coin offers a crazy opportunity to make huge returns with their new loot box scheme; check it out below.

There is a crypto coin out there for everyone, whether you're searching for something entertaining and user-friendly, you require speed, or you're a more serious trader with a taste for cutting-edge, thoroughly researched technology. The crypto train has undoubtedly started to move quickly down the track. Each of us must decide whether to board when it passes through our small towns or to remain on the platform, skipping the celebration in favor of a peaceful evening at home.

For more information on Big Eyes Coin:

Presale: https://buy.bigeyes.space/

Website: https://bigeyes.space/

Telegram: https://t.me/BIGEYESOFFICIAL

title: The Best Restaurants In Boracay - The Culture Trip
content:
After a long day of snorkelling and island-hopping, relax and enjoy yourself at one of the 10 best restaurants that Boracay has to offer.

Did you know – Culture Trip now does bookable, small-group trips? Pick from authentic, immersive Epic Trips, compact and action-packed Mini Trips and sparkling, expansive Sailing Trips.

Dos Mestizos

Bistro, Spanish, Filipino, $

Start with a few plates of tapas at Dos Mestizos | © Dos Mestizos | © Dos Mestizos

This family-run restaurant serves rustic and unpretentious Filipino-Castilian dishes. Dos Mestizos, meaning ‘two mixed-raced men’ in Spanish, is the brainchild of Jose Carlos Remedios and his friend, the late Jose Ramon Nieto, both of Filipino-Spanish descent. Established well over a decade ago, it is one of the most successful restaurants in Boracay – serving a selection of soups, tapas and five types of paella that blend Spanish and Philippine influences flawlessly. Their famed tapas night (which happens every Saturday), offers a hearty sampling of small platter bar chow. Don’t forget to visit their newly opened delicatessen Gusto y Gustos, which serves deli sandwiches using freshly baked breads – filled with succulent meats, Cubano and smokehouse grills and European cheese, smothered in the best condiments and organically grown vegetables from Remedio’s farm in Aklan.

Nonie’s

Bistro, Filipino, Vegetarian, Vegan, Contemporary, $

Only the freshest ingredients are used at Nonie’s | © Nonie’s | © Nonie's

Nonie’s is owned by married couple Patrick and Shria Florencio, who quit their corporate jobs to work with food and the community. The trendy restaurant is named after Patrick’s mom, focusing on carefully crafted healthy Filipino meals. The sustainable enterprise highlights locally-sourced produce and the freshest ingredients from suppliers in the community. Nonie’s has great options for vegetarians and specialize in a wide array of smoothies and pressed juices. Try their elegant pumpkin soup followed by a plate of bao sliders – which also has a vegan option. End the meal with the guilt-free flourless chocolate cake.

Sunny Side Café

Cafe, Contemporary, $

Before exploring the sandy beaches of Boracay, start the day right with breakfast or brunch at Sunny Side Café. The venue offers all-day contemporary breakfast dishes, achieving the perfect fusion of Filipino and American cuisines. The relaxing café sells delicious artisan coffees that you can pair with fluffy pancakes or a brilliant twist on the grilled cheese sandwich served with bacon and mango. All their breads and pastries are freshly baked each day. Walk along Station 3 in White Beach to find it.

Lemoni Café

Cafe, Contemporary

This refreshing open-sided venue inside the D’Mall offers all-day Filipino and American breakfasts, healthy salads, and homemade pastries and breads. The perfect place to recover after a night of debauchery – order brunch and go for the classic eggs benedict.

Subo

Bistro, Filipino, Contemporary

Experience Filipino food with a twist at Subo | © Subo | © Subo

Meaning ‘a mouthful’ in Tagalog, Subo is not your typical Filipino restaurant. It steers away from tradition and comes up with creative combinations to give Filipino food a fresh feel. Try the hot and sour broth soup called shrimp sinigang, similar to a Thai tom yung that features prawns, tomato, heaps of vegetables and batwan, a local Visayan fruit which serves as a souring agent instead of tamarind. The restaurant’s interiors feature antique Filipino-Spanish styled furniture, wooden floorboards, and windows made of capiz shells. The massive space can accommodate large groups, who can enjoy their meal while serenaded by local guitar players and traditional folk dances.

Prana

Bistro, Filipino, Contemporary, Asian, Vegetarian, Vegan

Prana offers a farm to table dining experience | © Prana | © Prana

If there’s such a thing as affordable haute cuisine in Boracay, Prana fits the bill. It is the signature restaurant of the Mandala Bay and Spa, who use local produce from their urban farm. The farm is located approximately 100km from Boracay, which in hand supports local producers. Headed by Executive Chef Peter Montemayor, who lived in Thailand and Bali, the spices and tastes of these two countries have been added to Filipino dishes. Cool off with a refreshing Calamansi mint slushie, made from a local citrus that is plucked straight from the garden. Follow this up with the Asian Tuna Tartare starter, that presents freshly-sourced tuna seasoned with lemongrass, ground toasted rice, bulgogi sauce and dried coconut. The menu stays away from red meat and focuses on fabulously presented healthy dishes, with a few that are also vegan-friendly.

Solana Shangri-la Boracay

Hotel Restaurant, Filipino, Contemporary

Dine in style at Solana Shangri-la, Boracay | © Solana Shangri-la Boracay | © Solana Shangri-la Boracay

Looking to impress a date with something a little more glamorous? Splash your cash by pre-booking a table at the Solana Shangri-la, which offers impeccable service, great food and a stunning view of Boracay’s sunset. The resort-restaurant features a large wooden terrace based on a cliff, offering a luxurious view of their private beach, with open-sided cabanas, outdoor lounges and tables that rest around a fire pit. Indulge in a variety of cocktails and international and Filipino-style seafood dishes. Start with a refreshing appetizer, ‘kinilaw na tanigue’, which is a local version of ceviche. Raw narrow-barred Spanish mackerel is marinated in local vinegar and lemons, chilli and other spices.

D’ Talipapa

Farmers’ Market, Asian, Filipino

Have fresh seafood cooked straight from the market at D’Talipapa | © Plato D’ Boracay | © Plato D' Boracay

Paluto, meaning ‘to have someone cook’ in Tagalog, is a standard service offered in well-known seafood markets across the Philippines. The goal at D’Talipapa wet market is to purchase the freshest shrimps, crabs, fish or whatever takes your fancy and have one of the many small, family grill restaurants cook it for you. Check the scales and don’t forget to bargain! Any shellfish stir-fried in butter, garlic, and fresh chillies is a sure hit.

Spice Bird

Bistro, Contemporary, Filipino, $

Dig in to a selection of piri piri marinated meats at Spice Bird | © Spice Bird Piri Piri | © Spice Bird Piri Piri

From the owners of Sunny Side Café in Boracay, expect high quality and good times at Spice Bird. Conveniently located inside D’Mall, this BBQ restaurant offers a refreshing change from the wealth of seafood on the island. It offers great value for money with large portions, presenting an array of barbequed pork and chicken, which are soaked for 36 hours in their signature piri piri (bird’s eye chilli) marinade. The mains are served with hearty sides and fiery homemade sauces to elevate your dining experience.

Smoke

Restaurant, Filipino

Savour authentic Filipino cuisine at Smoke | © Smoke | © Smoke

Hands down the best value for money family-style Filipino restaurant on the island. Established in 2004, Smoke has two branches in Boracay: the first located in D’Mall market, while the second sits across a Freestyle Kitesurfing school along Bulabog Beach. Popular with locals and travellers on a budget, this is the place to go if you want to sample authentic no-frills Filipino cuisine. Try their ultimate hangover-curing bulalo beef soup, paired with some freshly grilled fish of the day.
